problem_text:
Let G be a group such that every α ∈Aut G fixes every conjugacy class of G (setwise). Must Aut G = Inn G?
D. MacHale
answer: Not necessarily: the paper (H. Heineken, Arch. Math. (Basel), 33 (1979/80), no. 6, 497–503), in particular, produces finite p-groups all of whose automorphisms preserve all the conjugacy classes, while by Gaschütz’ theorem every finite p-group has outer automorphisms (A. Mann, Letter of 20 April 2006).
